story: NewsDad-of-three, 29, who 'deliberately infected women with HIV' must get written permission from police before having sexMagistrates ruled Aaron Sutcliffe, 29, is a risk to the public both in the UK and abroad and must tell the Lancashire Police public protection unit of any potential sex partner&nbspShareByElaine McCahill06:17, 22 JUN 2018NewsMagistrates ruled that HIV carrier Sutcliffe is a risk to the public both in the UK and abroad (Image: PA)&nbspShareGet daily updates directly to your inbox+ SubscribeThank you for subscribing!Could not subscribe, try again laterInvalid EmailA dad-of-three must get written permission from the police before he has sex after he deliberately infected women with HIV. In what is believed to be the first court ruling of its type, Aaron Sutcliffe, 29, must tell police officers of the name of anyone he is proposing to have intercourse with. Magistrates ruled that HIV carrier Sutcliffe is a risk to the public both in the UK and abroad and made him the subject of a full Sexual Risk Prevention Order. The order states that Sutcliffe unemployed of Westhead Walk, Fleetwood, Lancashire is a sexual risk to the public which needs protecting from harm. From now on he must tell the police public protection unit of any potential sex partner and whether he proposes oral, vaginal or anal sex.  The order covers both males and females. He must provide officers with contact details of the person to officers and must wait to get written police permission before he goes ahead with a sex act. The order granted on Thursday also states he must not have any of the forms of intercourse without wearing a condom on each occasion. You must stop having sex immediately if there is any indication if there is any indication that the condom is in any way damaged or deficient, the order states. You must tell the police public protection unit in the area where you live of the identity of the person you intend to have sex with. You must provide contact details of that person to the unit and get written acknowledgement of the notification. This order covers vaginal, oral and anal sex.

title: fiance defends partner after viral
story: NewsFiancée defends partner after viral Facebook post accused him of cheating on her while on lads' holiday to IbizaLucia Ghahramani, 31, says she is angry at the woman who accused her husband-to-be of being a 'love rat'&nbspShare&nbspCommentsByJessica CrippsNeil Murphy05:59, 22 JUN 2018Updated11:05, 22 JUN 2018NewsLucia Ghahramani says her wedding to partner Jack is still on (Image: Lucia Ghahramani)&nbspShare&nbspCommentsGet daily updates directly to your inbox+ SubscribeThank you for subscribing!Could not subscribe, try again laterInvalid Email The fianc&eacutee of a British holidaymaker accused of cheating on her in a viral Facebook post has jumped to his defence saying he's no love rat.  Lucia Ghahramani has strenuously denied that her husband-to-be Jack Troutt, 23, cheated on her while he was on a lads' holiday to Ibiza. The 31-year-old bride-to-be branded the woman who made the allegation, Steph Kendall, an attention seeker and has confirmed that her wedding to Jack is still on. “I don’t believe the girl. I know Jack and this girl is just attention seeking, she told The Sun. “The wedding is absolutely still on. I was angry, but more at her. Steph says she overheard Troutt bragging to mates that he slept with a woman the previous night and wrote a Facebook post about the conversation.  The post read: If this is your boyfriend Jack staying at the Azuline Bergantin hotel Ibiza him and his friends have been proudly discussing that he cheated on you last night Hun. Troutt says she simply misheard a conversation between his pals about previous relationships while sat around the pool.   The post was taken down by Steph 24 hours after it was published but had already been widely-shared on social media, including by Love Island star Kady McDermott who tweeted it to her 357,000 followers.  Jack, from Essex, has said he now fears for the future of his relationship due to the unwanted attention caused by the post.  It's devastating because I haven't done anything wrong. I haven't had any sexual relations with a woman on this holiday. I haven't kissed another woman or even kissed another woman on the cheek on this holiday. It's literally bizarre.  When he confronted Steph in the hotel to explain she had misheard him, he claims she walked away from him - and the post remained being shared on Facebook .   I tried to confront her and at the same time she just kept walking away from me. I said listen, you've got to get this post down, it's not true. She just walked away. I called her up through Facebook and she just said 'okay hun, bye'. I've got friends and family all contacting me asking me if I'm alright because of the amount of abuse I'm receiving from people all over the country. Jack is bravely speaking out and calling for tougher regulations on social media users accusing people of things that 'ruin their lives with no concrete evidence'. I am sure I am not the first person this has happened to and I know I won't be the last. I think there should be some sort of law or regulation put in place to say how you can make an allegation like that without having anything set in stone. I just think something needs to be put in place where posts like that where you could ruin people's lives without having the concrete evidence. I've reported this post to Facebook a thousand times but they're just not responding. They're just letting it keep getting shared and shared and shared.

title: intoxicated mum whose baby girl
story: News'Intoxicated' mum whose baby girl died in bed beside her is now teetotal with six-week-old sonAn inquest today heard doctors could not rule out the possibility that Clare Clifford's seven-month-old baby daughter Charlotte died after she rolled over onto her&nbspShare&nbspCommentsByBen McVayElaine McCahill21:22, 21 JUN 2018NewsClare Clifford, whose baby died while she co-slept with her, says her six-week old baby is helping her heal (Image: Yorkshire Evening Post / SWNS)&nbspShare&nbspCommentsGet daily updates directly to your inbox+ SubscribeThank you for subscribing!Could not subscribe, try again laterInvalid EmailA mother who was 'intoxicated' when her baby died while she co-slept with her has said her six-week-old son is healing her.  Clare Clifford, who says she is now teetotal, was unable to attend the inquest into her daughter's death today as she was caring for her six-week-old son Jack.  The digital marketing manager from Leeds, West Yorkshire, who insists she did not roll onto her daughter in bed, also has another daughter - Layla aged six. Speaking after the inquest into the death of seven-month-old Charlotte, she said: It's healing having a new baby but it also brings back a lot of bittersweet memories. I have to try and be logical and think that what happened with Charlotte was tragic - obviously I'm nervous when Jack is asleep. The nights are hard for me because I'm worrying about it happening again.  Clare said she and her husband James were trying to look to the future. She said: We are trying to move forward and trying to put our lives together again and trying to not let the nerves of what happened with Charlotte take away the joy of Jack being a baby. Clare said he knows she didn’t roll onto her daughter Charlotte but the inquest could not rule out the possibility that she did. Evidence from a pathologist found the infant was placed in an unsafe sleeping situation with an intoxicated mother on the night she died. But revealing her devastation earlier this year, light sleeper Clare insisted she just wouldn't have rolled onto her daughter.  She said: I’m always going to be wondering if I didn’t have her in bed that night - I’ll wonder that for the rest of my life.” She added: “In my heart of hearts I know I didn’t roll onto Charlotte. I just wouldn’t. I’m such a light sleeper and she was a very vocal baby.” The inquest into Charlotte's death heard how Clare had got into bed with the infant at midnight after drinking with her husband James. The couple had been drinking in their home, the hearing was told, with the mum saying she was in control of herself at all times. She awoke in bed with her baby at 4am on June 18 last year. Charlotte was rushed to Leeds General Infirmary, West Yorkshire, after she was found not breathing, but doctors were unable to save her.  She was pronounced dead 45 minutes later. According to evidence from pathologist Michael Parsons read out to the court, there was no specific post-mortem finding confirming death as a result of overlaying. However, the doctor also stated in a report that death caused by overlaying remained a possibility that could not be excluded. In written evidence read out by coroner Jonathan Leach to Wakefield Coroner's Court, Clare told how she described herself as merry on June 17, 2017. The evidence read On a scale of one-ten I would describe myself as a five. I am used to drinking alcohol and am used to drinking moderately - I was in control of myself at all times. Clare also wrote how she had been advised of the risk of co-sleeping, but she had never been told not to do it.

story: NewsNo efforts being made to find families of 300 victims of Gosport Hospital scandal whose lives were cut short by opiatesThe revelation means families may never learn the shocking truth of how their loved ones’ lives ended early “without medical justification”&nbspShare&nbspCommentsByNick Sommerlad22:37, 21 JUN 2018Updated22:40, 21 JUN 2018NewsBridget Reeves, whose grandma Elsie Devine died at the hospital, speaks following the publication of a bombshell inquiry (Image: Iam Vogler / Daily Mirror)&nbspShare&nbspCommentsGet daily updates directly to your inbox+ SubscribeThank you for subscribing!Could not subscribe, try again laterInvalid Email No efforts are being made to trace the families of almost 300 newly discovered victims of the Gosport scandal , the Mirror can reveal.  Instead, the Department for Health has set up a helpline and is waiting for relatives to “come forward”. It means they may never learn the shocking truth of how their loved ones’ lives ended early “without medical justification”. Families of other victims said it was “outrageous” and called on the NHS to find as many relatives as possible. Out of 456 victims identified by the Gosport Independent Panel, just 163 families have been in touch with investigators.  It leaves 293 victims whose identities are known after the panel uncovered their medical records. Another 200 victims “probably” died in the same way but their medical notes cannot be found. Victims included Arthur Cunningham, 79, who died in 1998, five days after being admitted with bed sores and frail Elsie Devine, 88, who died after being pinned down by four nurses and injected with a large, inappropriate dose of opioids. Gillian Wilson, 73, whose husband Robert died at Gosport War Memorial, said: “It’s terrible so many people haven’t been spoken to and haven’t been involved in the inquiry. They should go through their records and find every person who died in suspicious circumstances. It’s outrageous.”

title: no mother should outlive child
story: NewsMum faces heartbreaking prospect of both her baby and toddler dying before herChelsea Leigh Carter's beloved children Riley-Jay, two, and Layla-Rae, 11 months, suffer from cystic fibrosis and require round-the-clock care&nbspShare&nbspCommentsBySophie Dishman10:23, 22 JUN 2018Updated12:15, 22 JUN 2018NewsSisters Riley-Jay and Layla-Rae both suffer from cystic fibrosis (Image: Collect Unknown)&nbspShare&nbspCommentsGet daily updates directly to your inbox+ SubscribeThank you for subscribing!Could not subscribe, try again laterInvalid EmailA mum is facing the heartbreaking prospect of outliving both her baby and toddler who suffer from a life-shortening condition. Little Riley-Jay, two, and his sister Layla-Rae, 11 months, have cystic fibrosis and require round-the-clock care from their mother. Mum Chelsea Leigh Carter, 22, from Middlesborough, and her partner Dale are both carriers of the gene which causes the condition.  Chelsea told Teesside Live : “No mother should outlive a child.”  Cystic fibrosis causes a build-up of thick, sticky mucus in the lungs, digestive system and other organs.  Every morning, Riley-Jay and Layla-Rae receive a concoction of antibiotics and vitamins, which keep them alive, alongside physiotherapy twice a day. The youngsters have not had an easy start to life. Riley-Jay uses a nebuliser to help him breathe, while Layla-Rae is on medication for her iron levels. The pair also have to take capsules with every meal and snack - if it contains fat - and travel to the RVI Children’s Hospital every six to eight weeks for regular checkups. Chelsea said: “Their illnesses just keep going round in a circle.   Schoolchildren 'scarred for life' after camping kettle exploded 'like a bomb' during outdoor cooking class  “It’s absolutely heartbreaking as a mum. I constantly think about it, I even cry sometimes because my kids shouldn’t have to suffer. “I ask myself all the time, ‘why my kids?’ I’m just grateful to have my children.” She added: “It’s an invisible condition - you wouldn’t even know they have it. “There’s probably more bad days than good days to be honest.” The condition will affect them more as they get older, meaning they could need a lung transplant in the future. Chelsea said: “They deserve nothing but the best. I hate the fact they are going to need medication and physiotherapy for the rest of their life.

title: sas who dares wins star
story: NewsSAS: Who Dares Wins star who heard his wife being stabbed to death is engaged to woman who helped rebuild his lifeDad of two, Dan Cross, whose wife, Nicola, was attacked by a schizophrenic home intruder, will wed mental health clinician Alex Wells next year&nbspShare&nbspCommentsByLiz Dunphy10:17, 22 JUN 2018Updated11:27, 22 JUN 2018News&nbspShare&nbspCommentsGet daily updates directly to your inbox+ SubscribeThank you for subscribing!Could not subscribe, try again laterInvalid EmailSAS: Who Dares Wins star Dan Cross who heard his wife being stabbed to death over the phone is engaged to the remarkable woman who has helped rebuild his life. The dad of two, who listened helplessly as wife Nicola was attacked by a schizophrenic home intruder, will wed mental health clinician Alex Wells next year after dating for 15 months.  He said: I'm engaged to Alex. She's a remarkable woman. We're moving forward and hopefully going to get married next year. The children are really happy, he told BBC Three Counties Radio .  Nikki, 37, was brutally killed in September 2015 as she tried to protect her two children Stanley, six, and Isabella, three, from 25-year-old Marcin Porczynski who had broken into their home in Hemel Hempstead, Hertfordshire.  Dan, 40, was at work 200 miles away in Hull when he heard Nicola's screams down the phone as she pleaded for her life before she was stabbed 10 times. Porczynski later pleaded guilty at St Albans Crown Court to Nikki's manslaughter on the grounds of diminished responsibility and was ordered to be detained in a secure psychiatric unit for an indefinite period.   You can listen to Dan's full interview on BBC Three Counties Radio here.    Speaking about finding love with Alex, 27, while dealing with the heartache of losing Nicola, Dan revealed that he has his late wife's blessing explaining: We had that chat. We had discussed what would happen if one of us died young. Nikki said 'I want you to be happy. I want you to find someone else, someone that can look after the kids'. I was the clown and would say 'If I die young, I want you to wear black for the rest of your life and never meet anyone else'. We had the conversation so every day from the day Nikki died decision making was always based around what would Nikki do, what would Nikki want and we still do that today.  Nikki wanted me to be happy. She wanted the children to be happy. She was that type of person and that gives me confidence knowing I'm doing the right thing. I honestly believed for a long time that I would never meet anybody else and then gradually things changed and I began to realise that I didn't want to be on my own for the rest of my life and I knew what Nikki wanted for me. I was worried when I initially thought I was ready to start dating again,'Who would want to now?'   London Marathon cheat who crossed finish line with another runner's number to see a dream come true jailed  This is a guy who is seriously damaged goods, he's got a lot of baggage with him and Alex just takes it all in her stride. She's great with the kids. She's a mental health clinician and knows exactly how to deal with them. They love her to bits. Brave Dan, who following Nicola's death set up the charity Nikki's Wishes to help children who have suffered from bereavement in his late wife's memory, says they will never forget her. Dan added: There will always be that sadness that Nikki is not around. We'll always miss her. We'll always love her. We'll always remember her. We have to keep moving forward as well as holding onto that nice bit of the past. We do, obviously, have our daily issues that we need to address around the event of what happened to Nikki and that will continue, but in general we are a positive family and we'll keep being so.     Dan first revealed he had found love again back in January when he appeared on This Morning. He said: A year ago this weekend I met Alex, she's fitted beautifully into our lives. It's a brave decision to get involved with a family like this, she's a mental health clinician and she can do things with the kids. She does memory boxes where you use your hands and other techniques to bring back memories. It's been amazing, quite freaky really to have someone come in who's so perfect.      Speaking to Holly Willoughby and Phillip Schofield, Dan explained how counselling has helped him and his children to deal with the trauma.  He said: Stanley was six and Isabella was three at the time, I was telling her to leave and go to my mum and dad's but before she could leave he broke through the back doors and killed her. I didn't know what happened to the children until I heard them crying on the phone, and knew they were okay. Dan and his children moved in with his parents after the horrific night, but he returns to his former home sometimes so he can let out his emotions in private and feel closer to Nikki.  Dan underwent trauma counselling afterwards and said he experienced flashbacks within the first month after Nicola died. I felt like I couldn't breathe, I was back in that moment and then I realised if I'm going to be a good dad to the kids and make sure they're confident, happy adults then I need to get help, he said. Viewers of the Channel 4 show SAS: Who Dares Wins were reduced to tears when Dan spoke about how his children motivated him to survive their family tragedy.

story: NewsSchoolchildren 'scarred for life' after camping kettle exploded 'like a bomb' during outdoor cooking classThe youngsters, aged 11 and 12, were taking part in an outdoor cooking class at Lumphinans Primary School, in Fife&nbspShare&nbspCommentsByJames Moncur08:14, 22 JUN 2018NewsCharles Radlski is still recovering in hospital more than a week after the shocking incident&nbspShare&nbspCommentsGet daily updates directly to your inbox+ SubscribeThank you for subscribing!Could not subscribe, try again laterInvalid Email A camping kettle exploded 'like a bomb' at a primary school leaving three pupils with horror burns.  The youngsters, aged 11 and 12, were taking part in an outdoor cooking class when the kettle exploded and showered them with boiling water.  Two of the pupils were treated for scalding to their face and body. The third had burns on his back, reports the Daily Record .  The incident, which left one of the victims needing intensive care, happened during an extra-curricular activity at Lumphinans Primary School, in Fife.  The local council said a full investigation had been launched. Last night, Jo Griffin, whose son Ryan was one of the kids hurt, told of her horror after hearing he had been injured. Jo from Cowdenbeath, said: “When I arrived at the school, Ryan was in the nursery shower getting doused with water, screaming in pain – it was horrific to see. He was burnt all down his back and was in agony.” Ryan was rushed to The Victoria Hospital in Kirkcaldy and required further treatment the following day at the Sick Children's Hospital in Edinburgh. Jo, 35, said he had been to the school-run event with sister Rosie, eight, for five weeks. She added: “They’d used the same kettle the previous few weeks. The teachers taking the class said they’d been shown how to use it properly.” Ryan was on a bench close to the kettle when it exploded. He tried to run away when he saw water and steam pouring out of the top of it but couldn’t escape.

title: student developed anorexia after starving
story: NewsStudent developed anorexia after starving herself to fit into bridesmaid's dress for sister's weddingKatie Smith, 18, from Manchester, plummeted to a shocking 6st 7lbs in weight after she began starving herself, using 40 laxatives a day and jogging on the spot for hours&nbspShare&nbspCommentsByNicola Moors19:21, 21 JUN 2018NewsKatie Smith, 18, developed anorexia after hating the way she looked when trying on dresses for her sister's wedding (Image: HotSpot Media)&nbspShare&nbspCommentsGet daily updates directly to your inbox+ SubscribeThank you for subscribing!Could not subscribe, try again laterInvalid EmailAn anorexia survivor developed an eating disorder after starving herself to fit into a bridesmaid's dress for her sister's wedding. Katie Smith, 18, from Oldham, Manchester, dropped to just 6st 7lbs after losing a shocking 4st 7lbs, and was so skinny that she wore children's size 10-11 clothes. Then aged 15, Katie restricted her food to just 100 calories a day, consumed 40 laxatives and jogged on the spot for hours. But, in November 2017, after being admitted for inpatient treatment, she recovered and now weighs 10st 2lbs and is a size 10.  Katie, a student at North Chadderton Sixth Form College, says: I realised that if I carried on, I would die. It really made me want to get better. Having an eating disorder was awful, I never thought I'd make my 18th birthday. Growing up, Katie was a competitive swimmer and was always a healthy weight. I was never bigger than a size 10 but my frame was muscly and I weighed around 11st, she said. It was never anything that I worried about though.  But in February 2014, then aged 14, Katie developed bulimia. I would binge eat up to 5,000 calories before purging it up, she said. It became a cycle but, all the extra calories made me gain weight. In December 2015, Katie was trying on a size 12 bridesmaid's dress for the wedding of her sister, Joanne, 34, a teacher, when her eating patterns spiralled out of control. Katie said she felt horrendous.  The fabric clung to my figure and I hated how I looked, she said. After that, I developed anorexia. I exercised excessively every day, jogging on the spot for hours and performing 500 sit-ups. I only allowed myself to eat 100 calories of vegetables daily and I took 40 laxatives. Some days I'd eat nothing and I weighed myself constantly. I was determined to fit into the dress and look skinny at the wedding. I wanted to look good for the pictures.  Unsurprisingly, Katie's weight plummeted and within six months, her 5ft 5in frame weighed just 6st 7lbs. She added: I could fit into size 10-11 children's clothes, but I purposefully wore baggy clothes to hide how bony my frame was. I even stopped swimming when I was 14 so mum would never realise how skinny I'd gotten. My muscles ached constantly and I always felt cold. I had to wear multiple layers of clothes and my periods completely stopped. Handfuls of hair would fall out while I was in the shower and I'd be left with clumps of hair on my pillow. It was terrifying. In February 2016, Katie attended her sister's wedding in Ireland and by this point she'd already lost 2st 7lbs leaving her a size 6 and 8st 7lbs.  I was really looking forward to the wedding but on the day, I felt awful, she said. I didn't manage any of the wedding food. I felt huge even though now I realise I wasn't. My dress was a size 8 and hung off me. I pretended to family members that I'd eaten and played with the food on my plate. In March 2016 Katie was diagnosed with anorexia by her psychiatrist and she was admitted as an inpatient at the Hope Unit, Bury, Greater Manchester, where she underwent therapy for three months. A month later, she reached her lowest weight of 6st 7lbs. In June 2016, she was discharged as an outpatient but she relapsed over the summer.  Katie said: I felt self-conscious about my weight and how I looked, especially when my friends were wearing bikinis. I started restricting food again. It got completely out of control. For the next 17 months until November 2017, Katie was in and out of hospital battling her eating disorder. It was tough I missed a year of college to concentrate on getting better, she said. Then one day, I realised that I didn't want to die I knew that if I carried on, I wouldn't make it. I upped my calorie intake and stopped exercising. I realised my health was more important.

story: NewsTeenager, 14, travelled 8,000 miles across the world for surgery in WIGAN - and dad had to Google where it wasShaun East lives in the Falkland Islands and broke his collarbone in four places playing football&nbspShare&nbspCommentsBySam Yarwood10:13, 22 JUN 2018NewsShaun East lives on the Falkland Islands (Image: MEN/ WS)&nbspShare&nbspCommentsGet daily updates directly to your inbox+ SubscribeThank you for subscribing!Could not subscribe, try again laterInvalid Email A teenager who broke his collarbone in four places playing football travelled 8,000 miles for surgery in Wigan.  Shaun East, 14, lives in the Falkland Islands and after his injury was told by doctors he needed an operation on his shoulder.  The hospital in Stanley, capital of the Falklands , was unable to perform it, reports the Manchester Evening New s.  So doctors contacted Wrightington Hospital – which specialises in orthopaedic surgery – and arranged for Shaun to have his surgery in England.  The teenager flew from the Falkland Islands to Chile, followed by a transfer in Brazil that took him to Heathrow, before a final car journey to Wigan. He had the operation at the Royal Albert Edward Infirmary and was cared for on the Rainbow Ward. Shaun’s dad Justin, who was born in the UK, said he wasn’t even sure where Wigan was and had to Google it. He said: “When the doctors said we were going to Wigan I had to have a bit of a Google, because, even though I was born in the UK, I have lived on the Falkland Islands for 30 years, so I didn’t know exactly where it was – I just knew it was up north.” Puneet Monga, an orthopaedic consultant who specialises in sports injuries and shoulder surgery at the orthopaedic centre of excellence at Wrightington Hospital, carried out the surgery.

story: NewsWoman who left abusive note on ambulance banned from returning home as neighbours celebrate 'bliss'Police have worked with the council and the property owner to make sure Kirsty Sharman's former home will be rented out to a different tenant&nbspShare&nbspCommentsByRob AndrewsDanya BazaraaNews Reporter10:00, 22 JUN 2018Updated11:40, 22 JUN 2018NewsKirsty Sharman demanded the ambulance moved (Image: BPM Media)&nbspShare&nbspCommentsGet daily updates directly to your inbox+ SubscribeThank you for subscribing!Could not subscribe, try again laterInvalid EmailA woman who left an abusive note on an ambulance will not return home - as neighbours are celebrating their 'blissful' life since she was booted out. Kirsty Sharman made headlines worldwide after she left the note for paramedics while they were treating her sick neighbour in Stoke-on-Trent, Staffordshire. The message read: I couldn't give a s*** if the whole street collapsed. Now move your van from outside my house. Now Staffordshire Police have worked with the council and the property owner to make sure the 26-year-old's former Tunstall home will be rented out to a different tenant. It comes as a three-month closure order - which has seen the property boarded up since March - comes to an end this week, the Stoke Sentinel reports.  Magistrates granted the closure order after Sharman subjected her neighbours to 18 months of 'hell'. Those living nearby are now celebrating after being told Sharman cannot move back into the property. Dennis Viggars has revealed some residents even wanted to hold a street party after Sharman was kicked out. The Tunstall North Residents' Association chairman said: “When she was here you just couldn’t sit down and settle. “We got her out in the right way. We could have done it the wrong way and got in trouble ourselves but we persevered with phoning the police and in the end one person in the police thought ‘what on earth is going on here, let's sort it out’.  It took over 18 months to get rid of her but we did it in the right way. We didn’t hound her out, she hounded herself out. He alleged: “She was OK when she first moved in and we had no visions of her being a problem. But within two months it was chaos.” Dennis described the day of the closure order as a ‘great day’. He said: “We had to calm the kids down and one or two people and tell them to let the police and council get on with it. They wanted a street party when she went. “The ambulance incident started it all off again. It went viral all over the world. We had a friend in New Zealand who knew about it. It was disgraceful what she did. “I went across to have a look at the house after they kicked her out and God help the landlord when it re-opens. It would cost him thousands. It’s disgraceful. It must stink in there.”  He said the experience has brought the community together. He said: “I would like to see a good family go into that house. Hopefully we can have a say about who comes into the property because of what we’ve been through. “In the past few months life without her has been bliss. In some ways we are all better off for the experience.” Police have pledged to continue taking action to shut down problem properties. Chief Inspector John Owen said: “As the closure order comes to an end, we can confirm that the original occupant will not be returning to the address. story: NewsMystery of 'ghost' seen standing over boy, 5, is solved after mum shares spooky footageThe creepy video was captured by freaked-out mum Louise Denton in Paignton, Devon, last week - and it caused quite a stir on social media&nbspShare&nbspCommentsByBradley Jolly20:55, 21 JUN 2018Updated07:33, 22 JUN 2018NewsVideo LoadingVideo UnavailableClick to playTap to playThe video will start in 8CancelPlay now&nbspShare&nbspCommentsGet daily updates directly to your inbox+ SubscribeThank you for subscribing!Could not subscribe, try again laterInvalid Email An eerie figure which appeared to follow a five-year-old boy on a bicycle in spooky footage captured by his scared mum was actually a security guard - and not the ghost of a pensioner as suggested on social media. story: NewsBelgian city to turn abandoned hangar into 'mega-brothel' for sex workersPlans are in place to convert the building - which has protected architectural status - into a workplace for prostitutes as the red light district in the seaside town is being cleared&nbspShare&nbspCommentsByElaine McCahill20:37, 21 JUN 2018NewsProstitution is legal in Belgium and renting property for such work has been legal since 1995 (Image: Moment RF)&nbspShare&nbspCommentsGet daily updates directly to your inbox+ SubscribeThank you for subscribing!Could not subscribe, try again laterInvalid EmailA Belgian city is planning to turn an abandoned hangar into a mega-brothel which city officials say will be safer for sex workers. The hangar in the municipality of Ostend has protected architectural status and plans are in place to convert it into a brothel as the red light district in the seaside town is being cleared. The brothel will be known as Hangar d'amour and will be run by the same company that manages a 51-bedroom in Antwerp called Villa Tinto. The plan will see the town's red light district, known as Hazegras, cleared and moved into the hangar. Prostitution is legal in Belgium and renting property for such work has been legal since 1995.  Around 26,000 women are believed to work in the sexy industry there. It is estimated that 80 per cent of sex workers are victims of people trafficking or are exploited by gangs. There has been opposition to the plan with a non-profit describing it as madness. The non-profit, Oostendse Oosteroever, have been campaigning for the building to be turned into a museum. However, the mayor - Johan Vande Lanotte - says the hangar will be a safer environment for sex workers. He said: “The ladies will enter into a rental contract directly with the owner, as a result of which intermediaries will be excluded.

title: costa del sol beaches plagued
story: NewsCosta del Sol beaches plagued by monster jellyfish as holidaymakers scramble to remove them from waterMore than 11 tonnes of the whopper sea creatures have been dragged from the sea by authorities&nbspShare&nbspCommentsByKelly-Ann Mills11:06, 22 JUN 2018NewsVideo LoadingVideo UnavailableClick to playTap to playThe video will start in 8CancelPlay now&nbspShare&nbspCommentsGet daily updates directly to your inbox+ SubscribeThank you for subscribing!Could not subscribe, try again laterInvalid EmailThousands of monster jellyfish are plaguing popular Costa del Sol beaches as holidaymakers get set for the summer. More than 11 tonnes of the whopper sea creatures have been dragged from the sea by authorities and even sunbathers have been spotted helping to remove them. The worrying incidents have taken place in the province of Malaga, in the southern Spanish region of Andalusia across the coast from the resort. According to local media, cleaning boats have already collected 11 tonnes of jellyfish from on both the eastern and western coasts of the province.  Authorities say the jellyfish species belongs to Pelagia Noctiluca, one of the most common in the Mediterranean Sea in that area. Although this jellyfish's sting is not fatal it is said to be painful and cause inflammation. It is recommended to wash the injury with salt water and notify the lifeguards at the beach. A video shared by a man in a kayak shows him sliding over the impressive mass of jellyfish. He says: This is ridiculous.  They don't fit on top of each other. Organisation Aula del Mar confirmed that this is the largest presence of jellyfish since 2012. Another plague took place in 2015, but with nowhere near as many jellyfish. Aula del Mal coordinate a mobile phone app called Infomedusa - translated at Jellyfish information - to warn people about the presence of jellyfish near the beaches. The yellow flag has been raised on the affected beaches over the weekend, meaning bathers should take precaution.

story: NewsGirl, six, is 'lured away from family wedding by stranger' before being brutally sexually assaulted, murdered and mutilatedWARNING: DISTRESSING AND GRAPHIC CONTENT Chilling CCTV footage has been released showing the small child following a man into the street in India&nbspShareByKelly-Ann Mills11:39, 22 JUN 2018Updated11:41, 22 JUN 2018NewsVideo LoadingVideo UnavailableClick to playTap to playThe video will start in 8CancelPlay now&nbspShareGet daily updates directly to your inbox+ SubscribeThank you for subscribing!Could not subscribe, try again laterInvalid EmailA six-year-old girl has been murdered and mutilated after she was allegedly lured away from a family wedding with the promise of ice cream. Chilling CCTV has been released showing the small child, wearing a floor-length white dress, following a man into the street in India. At one point, she apparently gets scared and can be seen running fast.  She gets about 50 metres from the man, before she stops and follows him again after he starts to make his way towards her.  The little girl had been a guest at a wedding in Gwalior, Madhya Pradesh, and had attended with her parents, according to local media.  After she was allegedly lured away, she was 'brutally' sexually assaulted, murdered and mutilated. Police say a stone was used to disfigure her face.  The CCTV shows a man walking with the girl along a desolated street at around 11.30pm. She was reportedly last seen alive holding the man's hand as they both disappeared into the darkness. The footage shows the man returning alone around 2.30am. On seeing the child missing from the marriage venue, the parents raised an alarm after which police officers started searching for the girl. The huge search ended after they recovered the body of the child on a hillock 500 metres away from the venue in the early hours of Thursday. Police have since arrested a suspect. He is said to be a member of the catering team hired for the marriage function.  An investigation is still underway and the suspect is being questioned. The post-mortem report has suggested a brutal sex attack, and the girl's face was said to have been badly mutilated by a large stone. Police have registered a case under the POCSO (Protection of Children from Sexual Offences) act of Indian Penal Code.
